definition: a defensive effort, put up with something or somebody unpleasant
details:
noun
- a defensive effort
= example: a defensive effort
- a stop made by a touring musical or theatrical group to give a performance
= example: a stop made by a touring musical or theatrical group to give a performance
- a platform where a band, often a brass band, can play in the open air
= example: a platform where a band, often a brass band, can play in the open air
= synonyms: bandstand, outdoor stage
- a support or foundation
= synonyms: base, pedestal
- a support for displaying various articles
= synonyms: rack
- a booth where articles are displayed for sale
= synonyms: stall, sales booth
- tiered seats consisting of a structure (often made of wood) where people can sit to watch an event (game or parade)
- a small table for holding articles of various kinds
= example: a small table for holding articles of various kinds
- a mental position from which things are viewed
= synonyms: point of view, viewpoint, standpoint
- an interruption of normal activity
= synonyms: standstill, tie-up
- a growth of similar plants (usually trees) in a particular area
= example: a growth of similar plants (usually trees) in a particular area
- the position where a thing or person stands
verb
- put up with something or somebody unpleasant
= synonyms: support
- have or maintain a position or stand on an issue
= example: have or maintain a position or stand on an issue
- withstand the force of something
= synonyms: resist, fend
- be available for stud services
- be standing
= synonyms: stand up
- put into an upright position
= example: put into an upright position
= synonyms: stand up, place upright
- be in some specified state or condition
= example: be in some specified state or condition
- hold one's ground
= synonyms: remain firm
- be tall
- be in effect
- remain inactive or immobile
= example: remain inactive or immobile
- occupy a place or location, also metaphorically
= example: occupy a place or location, also metaphorically
